div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs. Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. W A R R A N T.
To C. B. HOPKINS, Marshal of the United States for the Dis- trict of Washington, Northern Division:
WHEREAS, Peter A. Clifford as applied to me for a warrant to take Alice B. Clifford, alleged to be in the custody of Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams; and

WHEREAS, it appears from the proof before me on such applica- tion that the said Alice B. Clifford is held in illegal custody by the said Herbert O. Williams and Grace E Williams, and that there is good reason to believe that she will be carried out of the jurisdiction of this Court before she can be relieved by a writ of habeas corpus, and this warrant having been ordered to issue by the Honorable the above named Court.

THESE ARE THEREFORE TO COMMAND YOU, in the name of the Pres- ident of the United States of America, that you forthwith take the said Alice B. Clifford and bring her before the Honorable above named Court, at the Court room there- of, in the City of Seattle, State of Washington, on the 9th day of June 1904, at Ten o'clock A M. of said day to be dealt with according to law.
WITNESS Melville W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, the 7th day of June 1904.
A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. By, HM Matthew Deputy Clerk.
W H White Attorney for Petitioner. J. J. Burt, Co Counsil.
United States of America, ) DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. ) ss.

I, C. B. Hopkin U. S. Marshal for the District of Washington, do hereby certify that I received the within Warrant on the 7 day of June 1904 and in pursuance thereof have the said Alice B. Clifford, before this Honorable Court as eviction I am commanded this 9 day of June 1904
CB Hopkins U. S. Marshal, By John Stringer Deputy.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTH- ERN DIVISION.
PETER A. CLIFFORD, Petitioner, vs. HERBERT O. WILLIAMS and GRACE E. WILLIAMS, Respondents. W A R R A N T.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. JUN 9 1904 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk. HM Matthew Deputy
W. H. White ATTORNEY-AT-LAW SAVINGS UNION BUILDING 530 California Street, SAN FRANCISCO, CAL. J. J. Burt, Co Counsil.
